intro: Porana duclouxii var. lasia, commonly known as the red-flowered porana, is a rare and striking member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical rainforests of Madagascar, where it thrives in shaded, humid environments. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red flowers, which are clustered in dense inflorescences, making it a notable ornamental species. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy, dark green surface. Due to its limited distribution and unique appearance, it is highly valued in botanical collections and conservation efforts.
